strf_parameters.interpretation: Spatial scales (25.00, 25.00) on a 100×100 grid imply moderately smooth surfaces with medium blobs. Variance σ≈1.000 yields high-variance fluctuations. Anisotropy (1.00, 1.00) gives a isotropic footprint, while temporal scale 10.00 over 20 scenarios points to persistent costs. Correlation footprint suggests roughly 5 distinguishable hotspots at any time.

cost_surface_gif.interpretation: Average gradient intensity is 0.07× the field's own scale, indicating very smooth surfaces. High-cost peaks average 0.9 per scenario with prominence ≈0.154. Hotspots cover 5.0% of the grid and show stable hotspots. Peak locations shift by ~9.55 cells per step (moderate drift), and gradients exhibit directional slope bias.

heatmap_gif.interpretation: Intensity spans [0.000, 1.000] with mean 0.534. Spatial variance averages 0.0134. Hotspots (95th percentile) occupy ~5.0% of cells and are stable over time. Centroid drift of 5.77 cells per step indicates moderate drift of dominant regions.

histogram_gif.interpretation: Scenario costs average 0.534 (median 0.533) with σ=0.047 (CV=0.09). Distribution is symmetric (skew=-0.04) with light tails (kurtosis=-1.34). Outliers beyond 3σ occur in 0.0% of scenarios. Later scenarios shift by -0.083 relative to early ones, signalling downward drift.

kde_gif.interpretation: KDE is bimodal with modes at 0.506, 0.570. Density concentrates between 0.449 and 0.611, with tail mass of 98.5% outside ±1σ of the mean. Mode locations drift across scenarios as indicated by the GIF.

violin_gif.interpretation: Medians range from 0.427 to 0.649. IQR averages 0.199 (σ=0.047), indicating moderate spread with consistent spread across scenarios. Shape symmetry score 0.13 denotes mostly symmetric. Upper tails hold 41.8% of total tail mass, signalling balanced tails.
